intro: Canthium vieillardii, commonly known as the African spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and hairy, ribbed stems. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinctive waxy coating. Canthium vieillardii is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional African medicine for various ailments.
